alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 8:22AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Grande Near San Ildefonso Pueblo affecting Santa Fe and Los Alamos Counties. Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Rio Arriba, Santa Fe and Los Alamos Counties. .Warm temperatures have melted snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...High flows and minor flooding caused by snowmelt. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Rio Grande at Embudo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor overbank flows are occurring above the Embudo gaging site. Access to riverside picnic facilities above Pilar and below the Taos Junction Bridge along state route 570 will be limited if further rises occur. Other localized effects due to the high water levels will begin to be felt at a stage of 10 feet but no significant flooding is expected until the river rises to 12 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 8.3 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then oscillate between 8.2 feet and 8.3 feet through Thursday but remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Monday morning around 1000 AM MDT.

area.areaDesc: Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe
